name: Accuracy
semantic: The degree to which data correctly reflects the real-world entity or event it represents.

name: Completeness
semantic: The degree to which all required data elements are present.

name: Consistency
semantic: The degree to which data is free from contradictions.

name: Uniqueness
semantic: The degree to which each record represents a distinct entity.

name: Timeliness
semantic: The degree to which data is available when needed.

name: Validity
semantic: The degree to which data conforms to defined business rules.
